intro: Solidago plantaginea, commonly known as the smooth goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescences that bloom in late summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Solidago plantaginea plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
